en.purpose: To provide a patient-centered assessment tool for quantifying symptom burden and risk for acute exacerbation of COPD, which can also be used to help guide the therapy plan.
en.use:
To assess the progression of COPD, the functional status, and the effectiveness of pulmonary rehabilitation. The assessment is based on eight criteria, each to be scored on a 0-5 numeric scale based on the severity, as such:
- cough: 0 (I never cough) to 5 (I cough all the time)
- pleghm: 0 (I have no phlegm in my chest at all) to 5 (my chest is completely full of phlegm)
- chest tightness: 0 (my chest does not feel tight at all) to 5 (my chest feels very tight)
- breathlessness:  0 (when I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am not breathless) to 5 (when I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am very breathless)
- activities: 0 (I am not limited doing any activities at home) to 5 (I am very limited doing any activities at home)
- confidence: 0 (I am confident leaving my home despite my lung condition) to 5 (I am not at all confident leaving my home because of my lung condition)
- sleep: 0 (I sleep soundly) to 5 (I don't sleep soundly because of my lung condition)
- energy: 0 (I have lots of energy) to 5 (I have no energy at all)

The scores are to be summed into the CAT score, with explanation as following:
- 0-10: low health impact
- 11-20: medium health impact
- 21-30: high health impact
- 31-40: very high health impact.
en.misuse: Not to be used for establishing a COPD diagnosis.

other_details.references:
1. Jones PW, Harding G, Berry P, Wiklund I, Chen WH, Kline Leidy N. Development and first validation of the COPD Assessment Test. Eur Respir J. 2009;34(3):648-54.
2. Dodd JW, Hogg L, Nolan J, et al. COPD assessment test (CAT): response to pulmonary rehabilitation. A multicentre, prospective study. The Thorax. 2011;66(5):425-9.
3. Global Initiative for Chronic Obstructive Lung Disease (GOLD). Global Strategy for the Diagnosis, Management, and Prevention of COPD. 2018 Report.

gt0001.description: The scoring tool to assess COPD symptom burden on patients' overall health.

gt0003.text: Cough. (0 - I never cough) to (5 - I cough all the time)
gt0003.description: The severity of cough symptom. 0 (I never cough) to 5 (I cough all the time).

gt0004.text: Phlegm. (0 - I have no phlegm in my chest at all) to (5 - My chest is completely full of phlegm)
gt0004.description: The feeling of having phlegm in the chest. 0 (I have no phlegm in my chest at all) to 5 (My chest is completely full of phlegm).

gt0005.text: Chest tightness. (0 - My chest does not feel tight at all) to (5 - My chest feels very tight)
gt0005.description: The feeling of tightness in chest area. 0 (My chest does not feel tight at all) to 5 (My chest feels very tight).

gt0006.text: Breathlessness. (0 - When I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am not breathless) to (5 - When I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am very breathless)
gt0006.description: The ability to perform intense activity without having the breathlessness. 0 (When I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am not breathless) to 5 (When I walk up a hill or one flight of stairs, I am very breathless).

gt0007.text: Activities. (0 - I am not limited doing any activities at home) to (5 - I am very limited doing any activities at home)
gt0007.description: How active the patient is at home. 0 (I am not limited doing any activities at home) to 5 (I am very limited doing any activities at home).

gt0008.text: Confidence. (0 - I am confident leaving my home despite my lung condition) to (5 - I am not at all confident leaving my home because of my lung condition)
gt0008.description: How confident is the patient for leaving home regarding the lung condition. 0 (I am confident leaving my home despite my lung condition) to 5 (I am not at all confident leaving my home because of my lung condition)

gt0009.text: Sleep. (0 - I sleep soundly) to (5 - I don't sleep soundly because of my lung condition)
gt0009.description: The quality of sleep. 0 (I sleep soundly) to 5 (I don't sleep soundly because of my lung condition)

gt0010.text: Energy. (0 - I have lots of energy) to (5 - I have no energy at all)
gt0010.description: Feeling of having energy. 0 (I have lots of energy) to 5 (I have no energy at all).
